#Text=Joachim Gans
#Text=Joachim Gans ( other spellings : Jeochim , Jochim , Gaunz , Ganse , Gaunse ) was a Bohemian mining expert , renowned for being the first Jew in North America . [ 1 ]
#Text=Biography
#Text=Early life
#Text=Gans was born in Prague , Kingdom of Bohemia , and therefore was most likely related to David Gans , who settled there in 1564 . [ 2 ]
#Text=England
#Text=He is first mentioned in his professional capacity at Keswick , Cumberland , in 1581 . [ 3 ]
#Text=He introduced a new process for the " making of Copper , vitriall , and Coppris , and smeltinge of Copper and leade ures . " [ 4 ]

column1: #Text=Gans figured in the English state papers of the reign of Elizabeth I and a full description of his operations is preserved in these documents , [ 4 ] printed by Donald . [ 3 ]
#Text=Gans 's most dramatic scientific discovery was to reduce the time to purify a batch of copper ore from sixteen weeks to just four days . [ 2 ]
#Text=Additionally , Gans was able to use the impurities removed from the copper ore in textile mordants . [ 3 ]
#Text=Colonization of America

#Text=Gans became the first Bohemian and the first recorded Jew in colonial America when , in 1585 , Sir Walter Raleigh recruited him for an expedition to find a permanent settlement in the Virginia territory of the New World .
#Text=Sir Ralph Lane , Governor of Raleigh 's expedition , led the Roanoke Colony on Roanoke Island off the coast of modern North Carolina in 1585 .
#Text=Among the ruins at the Roanoke site , archaeologists have discovered lumps of smelted copper and a goldsmith ’s crucible attributed to Gans 's work at the colony . [ 1 ]

#Text=Because the royal mining company failed to resupply colonists who were also becoming increasingly fearful of conflicts with the Native Americans , they accepted an offer from Sir Francis Drake in June 1586 to sail them to England .
#Text=Each of the colonists , including Gans , left North America .
#Text=Later life and trial for blasphemy
#Text=Gans moved to the town of Bristol where he gave Hebrew lessons to English gentlemen who wanted to read the Bible in its original tongue .
#Text=In 1589 , Bishop of Chichester Richard Curteys visited Gans who in speaking " in the Hebrue tonge , " proclaimed himself a Jew .
#Text=Bishop Curteys asked Gans , " Do you deny Jesus Christ to be the Son of God ? "
#Text=Gans replied , " What needeth the almighty God to have a son ?

#Text=Some critics have suggested that Gans was the model for the Jewish scientist Joabin in Sir Francis Bacon 's utopian novel , New Atlantis , although others have suggested Joabin is named after Joab , the commander of King David 's army and David 's co-conspirator in Uriah the Hittite 's death .
